question: What is the most common cause of nephrotic syndrome in children?

A 30-year-old male takes morphine as he feels good and also reports that it makes him feel light and relaxed. What are the two properties of this drug and its derivatives for which they are potentially used as drugs of abuse?

30-year-old Arshad came into the rehabilitation clinic as he uses cocaine and wants to quit. On assessment, he only needs the drug to satisfy his emotional and psychological needs but not getting the drug does not experience any withdrawal symptoms. What is he likely to have?

30-year-old Ayesha came into the psychiatry department with complaints of sweating, headache, nausea, and cramping pain if she does not take heroin. What are the symptoms she is experiencing termed as?

A 55-year-old male came with complaints of abdominal pain, high-grade fever with altered mental state, dysuria, and hematuria. His urine DR report shows numerous pus cells, nitrite positive, and few red blood cells. The physician diagnoses him with a case of urinary tract infection. Which of the following methods of urine collection has the lowest risk of contamination?

A 40-year-old man comes with the presenting complaint of localized pain in the perineum and suprapubic area, and pain during and after ejaculation. Detailed urine and culture reports show raised white blood cell (WBC) count and growth of E. coli. What would be the diagnosis?

A 10-year-old boy presents with a fever. On examination, he is hypertensive having a blood pressure (BP) of 140/90 mmHg. Urine analysis reveals 1+proteinuria, 3+hematuria, no ketones, no glucose, and RBC casts. On renal biopsy, hyper-cellular glomeruli containing neutrophils are noticed. The granular pattern on immune-fluorescence and electron-dense sub-epithelial “humps” on electron microscopy are also present. This child is suffering from which of the following renal diseases?

A 14-year-old boy presents with a history of lethargy and puffiness around his eyes. Laboratory results show serum creatinine and urea nitrogen within normal ranges. Urinalysis shows 4+proteinuria, no blood, glucose, or ketones, and a 24-hour urine protein content of 3.6 g. The child’s condition improves after a course of corticosteroid therapy. Which of the following best describes the underlying renal pathology in this child?

answers.option: Glomerular basement deposition of IgG antibodies

question: A 15-year-old teenage boy came to the psychiatry department as he wants to stop taking heroin. On assessment, he reported that he needs to frequently increase the dose of the drug to have the same effect as before. What is the teenager said to have developed?

A 16-year-old girl is suspected to be raped by her school teacher. She is brought in for an examination of the genitalia for signs of rape. On examination, the presence of carunculae hymenales was noted with no other obvious signs of other injuries. What do these findings suggest?

A 2-year-old boy presented in emergency for high-grade fever. His blood complete picture showed a high white blood cells (WBCs) count and C-reactive protein (CRP). Blood culture and urine culture confirmed the presence of Pseudomonas aeruginosa. Which one of the following is true related to Pseudomonas aeruginosa?

A 30-year-old man is brought into the emergency as he has overdosed on an unknown drug. On examination, his pupils are pinpoint, nonreactive to light, his breathing is sighing and pre-regular in pattern, and his body is profusely sweating. What do you think based on these findings he has overdosed on?
A 25-year-old woman was taking thiazide diuretics. After one week, she developed a rash and low-grade fever. Her blood complete picture shows increased eosinophil count. What would be the diagnosis?

A 30-year-old man started working in a shop that sold petroleum and its derived refined oil. After 2 – 3 days, he developed headache, vertigo, nausea, and vomiting. He was suspected to have developed acute poisoning. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A 35-year-old woman presents to the medical outpatient department (OPD) for a regular checkup. On examination, her blood pressure is slightly elevated at 180/100 mmHg. She is physically fit and follows a healthy diet. The physician decided to start antihypertensive therapy and prescribe hydrochlorothiazide. What is the possible mechanism of action of hydrochlorothiazide?

answers.option: Inhibits reabsorption of sodium and potassium excretion by inhibiting the aldosterone actions
Inhibits reabsorption of sodium chloride in the proximal tubule
Inhibits reabsorption of sodium chloride in the distal convoluted tubule
Inhibits reabsorption of sodium chloride in the ascending limb of the loop of Henle
Inhibits reabsorption of sodium chloride by inhibiting the carbonic anhydrase enzyme

question: A 35-year-old male presents with features of nephrotic syndrome. In addition, there is microscopic haematuria. Renal biopsy shows partial sclerosis affecting some of the glomeruli. Sclerosed areas show IgM and C3 on immune fluorescence. What is the most likely diagnosis in this patient?

A 4-year-old girl presents to the outpatient department with severe pitting edema. Further investigations show hypoalbuminemia, lipiduria, and 3.8 g proteinuria. Biopsy confirms the renal disease. Which of the following best describes the pathophysiology of proteinuria in this patient?

answers.option: Anti GBM antibodies cross reacting with alveolar basement membranes

question: A 40-year-old male presents to the emergency (ER) with colicky lower abdominal pain and hematuria. The attending doctor makes the preliminary diagnosis of urinary tract calculus. To confirm his diagnosis, the first radiological modality is:

A 40-year-old man has had increasing lower extremity edema for the past three weeks. On examination, his blood pressure (BP) is 135/90 mmHg and pitting edema up till his knees. Laboratory results show serum creatinine level of 1.2 mg/dl and urea nitrogen of 16 mg/dl. 24-hour urine protein of 7.4 grams. Serum ASO, ANA, HIV, and ANCA are negative. Complement levels are also normal. On renal biopsy, there is a diffuse uniform thickening of the glomerular basement membranes. Immunofluorescence shows granular IgG and C3 basement membrane deposits. In the given scenario, electron microscopy would most likely reveal which finding?

answers.option: Mesangial IgG and C3 electron dense deposits
Sub-epithelial IgG and C3 deposits electron dense deposits
Sub-endothelial electron dense deposits with duplication of basement membranes

question: A 44-year-old male came for a follow-up checkup with his laboratory results, which showed increased creatinine, urea, and PSA level. The physician suspected benign prostate hypertrophy. What is the most common manifestation of benign prostate hypertrophy?

A 44-year-old man complaints of swelling of legs and puffiness around eyes. His abdomen becomes protuberant and he feels shortness of breath. There is generalized edema and ascites. The urinary sediment contains many hyaline casts but no RBCs or WBCs. Renal biopsy immunofluorescence shows a granular pattern. Which of the following immunologic mechanisms was most likely responsible for glomerular changes?

answers.option: Release of cytokines by inflammatory cells
Cytotoxic T cells directed against renal antigens
Deposition of immune complexes on basement membrane

question: A 45-year-old patient with kidney failure was diagnosed with polycystic kidney disease. Both adult and childhood polycystic kidney diseases lead to end-stage renal disease and renal failure requiring dialysis. Which of the following is correct for this disease?

answers.option: Is a disease of women only
Occurs with the same frequency as autosomal dominant variant

Before a transplant, the renal transplant team visits the patient to take consent about the procedure and also from the family after counseling. For valid consent, the patient should be which of the following?

A 7-year-old girl presents with puffiness around her eyes. Examination shows a blood pressure of 100/60 mmHg. Laboratory investigations show serum creatinine and urea nitrogen are within normal ranges. Urinalysis shows 4+ proteinuria, no blood, glucose, or ketones. The 24-hour urine protein content of 3.9g. The child's condition improves after a course of corticosteroid therapy. Which of the following is the best option to describe her condition?

answers.option: Nephrotic syndrome due to membranoproliferative glomerulonephritis
Chronic renal failure due to dense deposit disease
Nephrotic syndrome due to minimal change disease
Nephrotic syndrome caused by cresentric glomerulonephritis
Nephritic syndrome due to post-infectious glomerulonephritis

question: SIADH is characterized by which of the following?

A 20-year-old man is brought into the emergency room after a morphine overdose. Upon examination, he is unconscious, pupils are pinpoint and non-reactive. Several injection marks are seen on his arms. What is the immediate treatment after maintaining the airway, breathing, and circulation?
In Pakistan, on which grounds is abortion justifiable?

A 58-year-old male presents with pain and tenderness at the right costovertebral angle. Laboratory investigations reveal microscopic haematuria but no protein or glucose. A complete blood count report shows microcytic hypochromic anemia. CT scan reveals an irregular renal mass 6 cm in diameter near the upper pole of the right kidney. Biopsy reveals atypical cells with abundant clear cytoplasm. Molecular studies would most likely identify mutations in which of the following growth regulatory genes?

A middle-aged man experiences increasing malaise, nausea with reduced urine output for the past two days. Laboratory investigations show a raised serum creatinine of 2.7mg/dl. Urinalysis shows hematuria. Renal biopsy reveals granular pattern on immunofluorescence. Which of the following best describes this patient's medical condition?

A 70-year-old male presents with complaints of pain in the groin, hematuria, and anuria. Ultrasound shows complete bilateral obstruction with dilated pelvis and calyces. The physician diagnoses him with hydronephrosis. What is the site of obstruction?
Which of the following conditions does not favor the development of "maceration" in a dead fetus inside the uterine cavity?

answers.option: Dead fetus remains inside uterus for at least 24 hours
Dead fetus is surrounded by liqor amni

question: A 25-year-old man presents with the symptoms of nephrotic syndrome. A biopsy of the kidneys, on electron microscopy, shows effacement of podocyte foot processes. What is the diagnosis?
What is the most common complication of a child with nephrotic syndrome?
Hospital waste can be classified into various types. Among the following which one is classified as pathological waste?

A 25-year-old woman with acute pyelonephritis was treated with oral ciprofloxacin. On day 8 of antibiotic treatment, the patient developed a maculopapular rash, low-grade fever, and eosinophilia. Serum creatinine was 2 mg/dl (baseline: 0.7 mg/dl). What would be the diagnosis?
During the first three months, what is the best-skilled method of termination of pregnancy?

30-year-old Arshad is dependent on morphine as it makes him feel good and also reports that it makes him feel light and relaxed. What are the properties of opium and its derivatives for which they are potentially used as drugs of abuse?
The use of potassium-sparing diuretics in patients receiving which of the following drugs needs close monitoring?
What is the treatment for hypernatremia in patients with chronic liver disease with ascites?
Which one of the following types of kidney stone formation is associated with a bacterial infection?

A 22-year-old woman presents with swelling of the legs. On urinalysis, there was increased proteinuria. She is diagnosed to have tubulointerstitial nephritis. It could have been drug-induced. It is characterized by which of the following?

answers.option: Increased glomerular filtration rate and oliguria
Appearance of symptoms after about two weeks of exposure
Dose dependent severity of the disease

question: Which of the following is the hallmark of nephritic syndrome?

answers.option: Hypertension with salt and water retreatment

question: Whosoever causes a woman with child, whose organs have been formed to miscarry, without good faith for the purpose of saving the life of the woman is known as what?
Pyelonephritis is encountered frequently in clinical settings. Gram-negative organisms are frequently implicated. What is the most common causative organism?

A 50-year-old man has noted passing darker urine for the past week. On physical examination, there are no abnormal findings. A urinalysis shows pH 5.5, specific gravity 1.013, 2+ blood, no protein, and no glucose. Urine cytology is performed and there are atypical uroepithelial cells seen. A urologist performs a cystoscopy, but no mucosal lesions are noted. He has a 60 pack-year history of smoking cigarettes. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A graduate student is planning to make a high-altitude climb in South America while on vacation. He will not have time to acclimate slowly to the altitude. What drug is useful in preventing high-altitude sickness?
Polycystic kidney diseases are genetic diseases. Polycystin 1 gene, is implicated in which of the following?

A 30-year-old man has noted puffiness around his eyes and swelling of his feet for the past 2 weeks. On physical examination, his blood pressure is 155/95 mm Hg. Urine microscopic examination reveals oval fat bodies. Which of the following conditions is he most likely to have?
What is the most important parameter for the analysis of arterial blood gases (ABGs)?

answers.option: Calculate the range of the compensatory response

question: What is the most common presentation of a road traffic accident victim who has suffered from severe renal trauma?

A 40-year-old male patient has presented with decreased urinary output of 5 days duration after he has been bitten by a snake. Which of the following investigations should be performed initially in this patient with acute renal failure?
What is the least likely cause of a urinary tract infection?
In acute nephritic syndrome, children and young adults are affected. Which is the most common age range for nephritic syndrome?
A 50-year-old man has a history of frequent episodes of renal colic with high calcium renal stones. Which of the following agents is most useful in the treatment of recurrent calcium stones?

A 60-year-old male, known case of diabetes mellitus, presents to the outpatient department, with complaints of uncontrolled blood sugar and bilateral pedal edema, gradually increasing for 4 months. On examination anemia and pitting edema is present. Laboratory results show hemoglobin: 10.1 gm/dl, total leukocyte count (TLC), and platelets: normal, urea: 60 mg/dl, serum creatinine: 2.0 mg/dl, eGFR < 60 ml/min/1.73m2. The most appropriate first investigation will be:
What is the commonest presentation of Wilms tumor?

The mother of a 9-month-old boy notices a mass on the right side of the infant's abdomen. Resection of the mass reveals a 10 cm well-circumscribed tumor which is of soft consistency. The cut section of the tumor is predominantly solid and pale gray with areas of cystic change, necrosis, and hemorrhage. Microscopically, the tumor is composed of blastemal, stromal, and epithelial tissues. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

Benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH) is an extremely common cause of prostatic enlargement resulting from the proliferation of stromal and glandular elements. The enlargement of the prostate in men with BPH is an important cause of urinary obstruction. Which zone is commonly involved in benign prostatic hyperplasia?

A 20-year-old-man comes with flank pain and urinary symptoms. He is diagnosed with having polycystic kidney disease. His family has a known mutation in the PKHD1 gene. PKHD1 gene, coding for a membrane receptor protein called fibrocystin is implicated in which of the following?
A 24-year-old patient presents with edema and hypertension is diagnosed with nephrotic syndrome. It can develop as a result of a number of renal injuries. What is it characterized by?
One of the signs of remote delivery in the living women is the presence of linea nigra a dark line of pigmentation in what location?
A post mortem examination was conducted on a 38-year-old parous woman to see the signs of remote delivery, what are the findings that would confirm the diagnosis?

answers.option: The walls of a uterus are concave from inside forming a wider and rounded cavity
The cervix and body of uterus are about the same length
The top of fundus is at a lower level than that of broad ligament
The internal os is soft, patulous, rounded with a dimple in the center
The external os is vertical irregular and admit 2 fingers

question: The hydrostatic pressure in Bowman's capsule is 18 mmHg, the hydrostatic pressure in glomerular capillaries is 60 mmHg, and colloidal osmotic pressure in the glomerular capillaries is 32 mmHg. What should be the net pressure to drive glomerular filtration?

A 33-year-old patient presents with bilateral swelling of the legs. On a detailed urine report, she was found to have increased proteinuria. She was diagnosed to have acute kidney injury. What features would suggest immune involvement in acute kidney injury?

Patients with nephrotic syndrome are vulnerable to infections due to loss of immunoglobulins in urine or nonselective proteinuria. Which of the following is the most common organism causing infections in a nephrotic syndrome patient?

A 66-year-old woman complaining of dysuria, polyuria, intermittent gross hematuria, and chronic low back pain. She had a history of urinary tract infections and pyelonephritis of the kidney. Urinalysis revealed urine sedimentation, a pH of 9.0, leukocyte esterase positive, nitrite positive, WBC 90-100/HPF, RBC 60-80/HPF. A KUB radiograph showed large calcifications in both kidneys. What is the most likely composition of these calcifications?

A group of medical students wants to conduct research on the serum and urine parameters of patients with minimal change disease. Which of the following laboratory test findings is most likely to be consistently present in these subjects?

answers.option: Renal tubular epithelial cells and casts

question: A 30-year-old man is brought into the emergency room after he overdosed on an unknown drug. On examination, his pupils are constricted, nonreactive to light, his breathing is sighing and irregular in pattern, his body is profusely sweating. Based on these findings, what has he overdosed on?

A 12-year-old girl has a history of throat infection with group A (ß-hemolytic) streptococci. Now she presents with hypertension, oliguria, and hematuria. Renal biopsy shows glomerulonephritis. Immunofluorescence microscopy in this case is most likely to show which of the following protein deposition in the glomeruli?

A 43-year-old man complains of increased fatigue and malaise for 3 weeks. His blood pressure is 150/95 mmHg. On examination, there is pitting edema of the lower limbs extending up to the knees. Urinalysis shows no glucose, blood, ketones, nitrite, or urobilinogen. Microscopic examination of urine exhibits no RBC or WBC. 24-hour urine protein is 4.2 gm. Serum creatinine and urea are high (3.5 mg/dL and 38 mg/dL respectively). Serum HBsAg is positive. Which of the following pathological condition is the possible diagnosis?
Two infants in different stages of development may be born in which of the following conditions?
What is the best treatment for localized T1 and T2 staged carcinoma prostate, in men less than 70 years?

A couple married for four years was unable to conceive a pregnancy. A detailed analysis of the sperms of the husband revealed azoospermia. They were suggested to go for artificial insemination by a fertility specialist. Which type of procedure would best suit the couple?
